channel.title: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays
channel.description:
Disclaimer- To any parent reading this after their kid got caught, FUCK OFF. To the kid, way to find a scape goat. Don't blame me if you get in trouble. If you do this right, you'll know everything that's under the tree, guaranteed.
Ok, now on how to commit this act of discretion. All you need is:
[ul][li]One arm of the scissors. (No, you don't have to break them in half, the sharper it is, the better.)[/li] [li]Scotch, or the type of tape that your parents used to wrap your present[/li][/ul]
That's it, so now on how to actually do it.
So you got a present, and your wondering what the fuck it is, well here I am to help you.
Pick up your present, lets say it's a rectangle: [img]http://img103.imageshack.us/img103/3858/35548468wr8.png[/img]
Take your one scissor arm, or knife, or whatever you decided to use and make the following cuts.
[img]http://img137.imageshack.us/img137/6889/83039059wg8.png[/img]
Make sure that you press down hard enough that it will make an incision, but at the same time won't tear a hole for your family to see every time they walk in the living room and you get grounded. If you can't make a clear incision that's straight, then try making light smooth ones that you go over a bunch of times to make a clear one. That's why, every year, I practice on my siblings presents to get back into being able to do it well. That way, I can do mine well, and I also know what they're getting (knowledge is power). If your an only child, your in luck, just use a smaller present from the back to start on, one that you know you'll be able grab in the present unwrapping and rip to shreds before your parents can see what you've done.
Now that you've made the cut, and know what I do every december, it's time to find out what your parents don't want you to know. Just fold back the paper, and see what's underneath. Do these cuts anywhere that you think will tell you what the gift is. I chose a place that most places put the title. but sometimes the side or the top works just as well. Once you are done, and you know what each of your gifts are, just put tape on the incisions, and it looks like nothing happened.
Happy gift searching!
Buzzy

item.title: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays
item.dc:creator: @w00d_returns w00d returns
item.description:
@w00d_returns wrote:

What if you cut on the fucking backside?

Read full topic
item.source: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays

item.title: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

I just take pictures, undo the wrappings in steps, put the same kind of tape exactly on top of the old tape after folding it back.
Totally easy

Read full topic
item.source: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays

item.title: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Lol, I got an Xbox 360 Elite for Christmas, I wen’t and picked it out, came home and started playing Halo 3. Then I wen’t with my brother and he bought me a controller, two rechargable battery packs, Dead Rising and a book to a series I’m reading. So I’ve gotten all my presents early. Lol. Only person I’m waiting for is my sister, so I don’t expect anything else.

Read full topic
item.source: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays

item.title: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

Buzzy:

Wow, that seems pretty fucking meaningless to me. Why the fuck do you even bother posting?

Good job, you know what flaming is?

.Kaboom:

Why ruin the suprise of Christmass.

Because if you don’t, you’re a little kid hoping for a surprise, ending up with a sweater.

Unfortunatly… This guide is useless to me, because I like surprises, and I don’t give a crap on what I get for christmas.

Read full topic
item.source: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays

item.title: How to find out what you've gotten for the holidays
item.dc:creator: @Buzzy Buzzy
item.description:
@Buzzy wrote:

Disclaimer- To any parent reading this after their kid got caught, FUCK OFF. To the kid, way to find a scape goat. Don’t blame me if you get in trouble. If you do this right, you’ll know everything that’s under the tree, guaranteed.

Ok, now on how to commit this act of discretion. All you need is:

[ul][li]One arm of the scissors. (No, you don’t have to break them in half, the sharper it is, the better.)[/li]

That’s it, so now on how to actually do it.

So you got a present, and your wondering what the fuck it is, well here I am to help you.

Pick up your present, lets say it’s a rectangle:

Take your one scissor arm, or knife, or whatever you decided to use and make the following cuts.

Make sure that you press down hard enough that it will make an incision, but at the same time won’t tear a hole for your family to see every time they walk in the living room and you get grounded. If you can’t make a clear incision that’s straight, then try making light smooth ones that you go over a bunch of times to make a clear one. Now that you’ve made the cut, and know what I do every december, it’s time to find out what your parents don’t want you to know. Just fold back the paper, and see what’s underneath. Do these cuts anywhere that you think will tell you what the gift is. I chose a place that most places put the title. but sometimes the side or the top works just as well. Once you are done, and you know what each of your gifts are, just put tape on the incisions, and it looks like nothing happened.

Happy gift searching!

Buzzy
